p: Critical too, are the spatial, temporal, and affective dynamics of these proximities: just as graves shape the contemporary politics of land in Zimbabwe, so the hotspot draws attention to the co-presence of divergent histories within sites of VHF transmission and management. The intersections between colonial remainders, independence policies, public health practice, and the emotive registers that inflect practices of care and support have tremendous significance for the pathogenicity of a milieu.
